parameters.name: DestinationDescription
parameters.description: The description of the image copy. The description must be 2 to 256 characters in length and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: DestinationImageName
parameters.description: The name of the image copy. The name must be 2 to 128 characters in length. The name must start with a letter and cannot start with `acs:` or `aliyun`. The name cannot contain `http://` or `https://`. The name can contain letters, digits, periods (.), colons (:), underscores (\_), and hyphens (-).

parameters.name: DestinationRegionId
parameters.description: The ID of the destination region to which the source custom image is copied.

parameters.name: Encrypted
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to encrypt the image copy.

Default value: false.

parameters.name: ImageId
parameters.description: The ID of the source custom image.

parameters.name: KMSKeyId
parameters.description: The ID of the key used to encrypt the image copy.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The region ID of the source custom image. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~25609~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: ResourceGroupId
parameters.description:
The ID of the resource group to which the image copy belongs. If you do not specify this parameter, the image copy belongs to the default resource group.

> If you call the CopyImage operation as a Resource Access Management (RAM) user who is not authorized to manage the default resource group and do not specify the `ResourceGroupId` parameter, the `Forbidden: User not authorized to operate on the specified resource` error message is returned. You must specify the ID of a resource group that the RAM user is authorized to manage or authorize the RAM user to manage the default resource group before you call the CreateImage operation again.
